citations.narrative:
Records were not available for several species of animals at the facility. Records containing the required information must
be maintained by the facility and be available at the time of inspection. The facility must maintain records of all animals
housed at the facility. These records must contain the required information per this section of the regulation, such as
name and address from where the animal was acquired, date of purchase, animal species and USDA license number if
the individual is licensed with USDA. The licensee must maintain records containing the required information.
*********Correct by October 1, 2023

In the self drive thru-safari area the public is permitted to offer feed to the animals anywhere along the self drive through
route. Some animals, including camels and ostriches, extend their heads and necks through open windows and into
vehicles, which poses a significant risk of injury. The licensee states that attendants are present in this area at all times,
however these occurrences can lead to injury of animals. During public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is
minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public, with sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animal and the
general viewing public so as to assure the safety of animals and the public.
******Correct before public exhibition or June 1,2023

1. A portion of wire was observed wrapped around the antlers of a fallow deer. This can cause injury to the animal.
Enclosures must be maintained in good repair in order to prevent injury to the animals.
2. A drainage swail was located in the large safari park area. An exposed bolt was located on one side, which could be a
hazard and cause injury to the animals.
3. A board with an exposed nail was found on the ground in the large bird enclosure at the back of the walk through area.
This could pose a risk of injury to the animals.
Enclosures must be maintained in good repair in order to prevent injury to the animals. The licensee must correct this
issue.
********Correct by September 21, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
Tonya Hadjis, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n

narrative:
2.75(b)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Records were not available for several species of animals at the facility. Records containing the required information must 
be maintained by the facility and be available at the time of inspection. The facility must maintain records of all animals 
housed at the facility. These records must contain the required information per this section of the regulation, such as 
name and address from where the animal was acquired, date of purchase, animal species and USDA license number if 
the individual is licensed with USDA. The licensee must maintain records containing the required information.  
*********Correct by October 1, 2023 
2.131(c)(1) 
   
Handling of animals. 
In the self drive thru-safari area the public is permitted to offer feed to the animals anywhere along the self drive through 
route. Some animals, including camels and ostriches, extend their heads and necks through open windows and into 
vehicles, which poses a significant risk of injury. The licensee states that attendants are present in this area at all times, 
however these occurrences can lead to injury of animals. During public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is 
minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public, with sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animal and the 
general viewing public so as to assure the safety of animals and the public. 
******Correct before public exhibition or June 1,2023 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
1. A portion of wire was observed wrapped around the antlers of a fallow deer. This can cause injury to the animal. 
Enclosures must be maintained in good repair in order to prevent injury to the animals.  
2. A drainage swail was located in the large safari park area. An exposed bolt was located on one side, which could be a 
hazard and cause injury to the animals. 
3. A board with an exposed nail was found on the ground in the large bird enclosure at the back of the walk through area. 
This could pose a risk of injury to the animals. 
 Enclosures must be maintained in good repair in order to prevent injury to the animals. The licensee must correct this 
issue.  
********Correct by September 21, 2023

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Tonya Hadjis, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n
